definition: to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up

sentences.english: You can't swallow the idea in that book overnight.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一個晚上囫圇吞棗式地讀完那本書。

sentences.english: Do not read without understanding. One should get what he need.
sentences.chinese: 讀書不能囫圇吞棗，而要從中吸取自己需要的東西。

sentences.english: Do you scoff down a huge lunch before feeling lethargic all afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 囫圇吞棗的喫完午飯，然後又整個下午昏昏沉沉？

sentences.english: Trying to digest new information in one lump is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 想囫圇吞棗消化吸收新信息是困難的。

sentences.english: Some students gobble up information as fast as they receive it.
sentences.chinese: 有些學生一接觸信息就囫圇吞棗地馬上吸收。

definition: to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
